      • TRAINPIECE_LIMIT

        public static final int TRAINPIECE_LIMIT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String name,
              TeamColor teamColor)
        Initializes a Player. A Player contains:
        • private String name;
        • private TeamColor teamColor;
        • private int trainPieces;
        • private int score;
        • private List<TrainCardOrRouteColor> trainCards;
        • private List<DestinationCard> destinationCards;
        Parameters:
        name - Initializes a Player's name. Can be any name, nickname recommended.
        teamColor - TeamColor enum.

    • Method Detail

      • displayTrainCards

        public void displayTrainCards()
        Prints all of a player's trainCards to console, 1 per line.

      • displayDestinationCards

        public void displayDestinationCards()
        Prints all of a player's destinationCards to console, 1 per line. It is formatted:
        sourceString + destinationString + scoreString

      • containsTrainCards

        public boolean containsTrainCards(TrainCardOrRouteColor trainCard,
                                  int quantity)
        This method is used to test if a Player contains quantity of a certain color trainCard. If you want to check if a player has 3 red TrainCards, evoke this method with player.containsTrainCards(TrainCardOrRouteColor.RED, 3);
        Parameters:
        trainCard - TrainCardOrRouteColor enum.
        quantity - Number of occurrences to check for.
        Returns:
        If Player has quantity trainCards, return true, else false.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        Player's name, most likely a nickname.

      • getTeamColor

        public TeamColor getTeamColor()
        Returns:
        TeamColor enum representing the team a Player is on. Used for distinguising game token pieces from Player to Player. Can be used for team-based gaming.

      • getTrainPieces

        public int getTrainPieces()
        Returns:
        The number of trainPieces a player has. In vanilla, when a Player has less than or equal to 2 trainPieces remaining, each player has 1 final turn.

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Returns:
        A Player's score. Score is usually calculated at the very end.

      • getTrainCards

        public java.util.List<TrainCardOrRouteColor> getTrainCards()
        Returns:
        A List of a Player's trainCards.

      • getDestinationCards

        public java.util.List<DestinationCard> getDestinationCards()
        Returns:
        A List of a Player's destinationCards.

      • addTrainCardToHand

        public void addTrainCardToHand(TrainCardOrRouteColor trainCardColor)
        Adds a single trainCard of a specific TrainCardOrRouteColor to a Player's hand. This is useful for whenever a Player needs to draw a card. The cards are guaranteed to always be shuffled if they are from Cards. You will need to add a trainCard from Cards which contains the entire deck of cards.
        Parameters:
        trainCardColor - Enum TrainCardOrRouteColor.

      • addDestinationCardToHand

        public void addDestinationCardToHand(DestinationCard destinationCard)
        Adds a single destinationCard to a Player's hand. This is useful for whenever a Player needs to draw a card. The cards are guaranteed to always be shuffled if they are from Cards. You will need to add a destinationCard from Cards which contains the entire deck of cards.
        Parameters:
        destinationCard - DestinationCard object.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set's a Player's name. This is the name that other human players will see. Do not use a personal identification number to identify a Player - it's recommended to use a nickname.
        Parameters:
        name - The name assigned to a human player that is known to everyone.

      • setTeamColor

        public void setTeamColor(TeamColor teamColor)
        Set's a Player's TeamColor. There can be multiple Players on the same team with special game rules you can define. In vanilla, there is at most 1 Player per TeamColor.
        Parameters:
        teamColor - A player's TeamColor.

      • setTrainPieces

        public void setTrainPieces(int trainPieces)
        This sets the number of trainPieces a Player has. In vanilla, the end condition for the game is when a Player has 2 or less trainPieces remaining - then all Players will have 1 more turn, then the scores are calculated.
        Parameters:
        trainPieces - Set the number of trainPieces a player has.

      • setScore

        public void setScore(int score)
        Sets a Player's score. In vanilla, this is determined at the end. The end occurs after the final turn. The final turn triggers when a Player has 2 or less trainPieces remaining. A Player's score at the end is the determiner of who won the game.
        Parameters:
        score - Sets the Player's score with a nonnegative integer.

      • addPointToScore

        public void addPointToScore()
        Adds 1 point to a Player's score. In vanilla, this is determined at the end. The end occurs after the final turn. The final turn triggers when a Player has 2 or less trainPieces remaining. A Player's score at the end is the determiner of who won the game.

      • subtractPointFromScore

        public void subtractPointFromScore()
        Subtracts 1 point to a Player's score. In vanilla, this is determined at the end. The end occurs after the final turn. The final turn triggers when a Player has 2 or less trainPieces remaining. A Player's score at the end is the determiner of who won the game.

      • setTrainCards

        public void setTrainCards(java.util.List<TrainCardOrRouteColor> trainCards)
        Sets a Player's trainCards (a Player's hand). This is useful for whenever a Player needs to draw a lot of cards without a loop. The cards are guaranteed to always be shuffled if they are from Cards. You will need to add a trainCard from Cards which contains the entire deck of cards.
        Parameters:
        trainCards - List containing TrainCardOrRouteColor enum objects.

      • setDestinationCards

        public void setDestinationCards(java.util.List<DestinationCard> destinationCards)
        Sets a Player's destinationCards (a Player's hand). This is useful for whenever a Player needs to draw a lot of cards without a loop. The cards are guaranteed to always be shuffled if they are from Cards. You will need to add a trainCard from Cards which contains the entire deck of cards.
        Parameters:
        destinationCards - List containing DestinationCard objects.

      • addTrainPiece

        public void addTrainPiece()
        This adds 1 to the number of trainPieces a Player has. In vanilla, the end condition for the game is when a Player has 2 or less trainPieces remaining - then all Players will have 1 more turn, then the scores are calculated.

      • removeTrainPiece

        public void removeTrainPiece()
        This subtracts 1 to the number of trainPieces a Player has. In vanilla, the end condition for the game is when a Player has 2 or less trainPieces remaining - then all Players will have 1 more turn, then the scores are calculated.

      • removeTrainCardsFromHand

        public void removeTrainCardsFromHand(TrainCardOrRouteColor trainCard,
                                     int quantity)
        Removes trainCards of a specific TrainCardOrRouteColor from a Player's hand. This is useful for whenever a Player needs to place trainPieces on the game board - in vanilla a Player can play trainPieces if the Player has enough trainCards of the TrainCardOrRouteColor the trainPieces will be place on. The cards are guaranteed to always be shuffled if they are from Cards. You will need to add a trainCard from Cards which contains the entire deck of cards.
        Parameters:
        trainCard - The trainCard of a color to remove from a Player's hand.
        quantity - The amount of the trainCards to remove from a Player's hand.
